reviewText: Purchased this dvd for $3 clearance at vid-store and was an excellent intro to the Zero Woman films. Chieko Shiratori plays the role of Rei, an operative of Zero Division, a special operations department of the Tokyo Metropolice. Each film has a different actress in the role. This film has the character of Rei tasked with the protection of a girl whose boyfriend stole money from a crime boss in order to leave the country. The two of them have to survive the inevitable kidnap/assassinate attempts and Rei convinces the girl to leave Japan and start a new life somewhere else. The irony is that the girl goes back to try and take over the criminal gang (the boss and boyfriend now deceased) but is killed by the new boss. Rei then goes on a killing spree that takes out everyone in the gangs mansion and laments the death of her charge. The action drives the film but the story is developed as well. Best way to describe these films- Think a female Japanese action heroine, not quite James Bond, but definitely an agent not to be messed with. This film led to the looking up info for the franchise (Wikipedia) and the purchase of other films in the series. Excellent film and good quality acting.
summary: Excellent intro to the Zero Woman
Title: N/A

reviewText: Chieko Shiratori is super cute as an agent of the Zero Department. I was expecting over the top violence along the lines of Tokyo Gore Police or The Machine Girl. The movie didn't deliever for action. Director Hidekazu Takahara could have spiced it up a whole lot more. Then again, I'm a fan of extreme violence. The action is the weakest part of this movieThe best part is the relationship better Rei, Shiratori, and Nana, Ichiho Matsuda. They start out hating each other and getting on each other nerves as even the best of friends seem to be able to locate those mental pressure points that drive you up the wall. Rei is assigned to protect Nana and after Rei kills several assasins at Nana's apartment, they are forced to move into Rei's apartment.This is where the real fun of the movie starts. After getting on each others nerves and various trust issues, they slowly bond, which results in a cool lesbian scene that could have lasted longer. But this isn't porn so there are better films for that.I do agree with Nana as she tells Rei that you can having a deep relaxing sleep after causal sex. I think this breaks down Rei's tough girl front.They bond together more and more until Rei actually is helping Nana escape from the mob life. When they start trusting each other the fun begins. There are cool scenes of Nana looking cool and tough while blasting away various mobsters and doctors. There is something appealing about beautiful women with guns.Overall, this is a nice quiet film with tender lesbian moments, witty dialouge that isn't cheesy, and a little action throw in. There could have been more action, blood, gore, car chasers, swearing and other things that guys love.
Title: N/A
